content:
Hi everyone,
another question from me. In my FSH-project I'd like to use refer to German base profiles. I added the dependency like this in sushi-config.yaml:

dependencies:
  de.basisprofil.r4:
    uri: https://simplifier.net/basisprofil-de-r4
    version: 1.0.0

Now I get the following error (example error, also applies to other profiles):

Structure Definition http://fhir.de/StructureDefinition/humanname-de-basis is missing snapshot. Snapshot is required for import.

What do I need to run sushi without any problems? Do you have advise for me?
Thanks in advance to everyone contributing.
@Mareike Przysucha download the German base profiles package from Simplifier with snapshots included and replace it in your local package cache.

Thank you, @Julian Sass, that was my problem.
In the .fhir-folder there were only the differentials, not the snapshots.
Mareike Przysucha has marked this topic as resolved.

@Mareike Przysucha I would recommend using Firely Teminal to install you packages. The latest release of Firely Teminal has a "bake" functionality in there that automatically generates snapshots for all the packages you want to install. You can install Firely Terminal easily on your command line https://simplifier.net/downloads/firely-terminal

The benefit of using Firely Terminal to generate the snapshots is that you always use the latest version of the .NET SDK snapshot generator.
good recommendation. Any chance that this will be included into sushi?
Thanks @Matthijs van der Wielen. I'll try it later, as I am in meetings today. But I appreciate your advice.

Patrick Werner said:

good recommendation. Any chance that this will be included into sushi?

We're working w/ Firely to determine the best way to support this workflow. As a start, we plan to provide detailed documentation on how to use the Firely Terminal to satisfy the requirements of SUSHI. Eventually it would be nice to support it in a seamless fashion, but we're still working out the technical details regarding how something like that might work.
